This example shows how to configure Gigabit Ethernet port 5/1 to send CDP packets that tell the Cisco IP phone to configure its access port as trusted:

Router# configure terminal
Router(config)# interface gigabitethernet 5/1
Router(config-if)# platform qos trust extend

comments.content: Looks like someone doesn't like competition and in purpose mark incorrect answers, even below are explain in details why most voted answer is correct.
you always pick wrong answers here stop doing this when you have no clue what are you talking about

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D. To configure switch port 5/1 to send CDP packets to configure an attached Cisco IP phone to trust tagged traffic on its access port, the command "platform qos trust extend cos 5" should be used. This command enables the switch port to trust the CoS value of incoming packets with a CoS value of 5 or higher.

Option A, "platform qos trust extend cos 3", specifies that incoming packets with a CoS value of 3 or higher should be trusted, which is not consistent with the requirement to trust packets with a CoS value of 5 or higher. Option B, "platform qos extend trust", is an invalid command. Option C, "platform qos trust extend Most Voted", is not a valid option for configuring a switch port to send CDP packets to configure an attached Cisco IP phone to trust tagged traffic on its access port.

Selected Answer: C
platform qos trust extend

Confirming that the answer is:
C - platform qos trust extend

I think the correct command is platform qos trust extend. Not "extend trust"

questions.question_text:
An engineer must configure switch port 5/1 to send CDP packets to configure an attached Cisco IP phone to trust tagged traffic on its access port. Which command is required to complete the configuration?

Router# configure terminal -
Router(config)# interface gigabitethernet 5/1
Router(config-if)# description Cube E42.421-5965
Which DSCP marking is represented as 101110 in an IP header?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. That binary notation is = 46

Selected Answer: D
With the first 3 bits (ip precedence) you can deduce the answer. 101 is IP precedence mapped to Expedited Forwarding (EF),

Selected Answer: D
The QoS markings are in the 6-bit DSCP field of the ToS Byte of the IP header. The recommended (Default) value for RTP (voice) is 101110, which is EF / Expedited Forwarding.

D

questions.question_text: Which service on the Presence Server is responsible for maintaining the point-to-point chat connections between Jabber clients?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The Cisco XCP Text Conference Manager supports the Chat feature. The Chat feature allows users to communicate with each other in online chat rooms. It supports chat functionality using ad hoc (temporary) and permanent chat rooms, which remain on a Cisco-supported external database until they are deleted.

Selected Answer: A
The service on the Presence Server responsible for maintaining the point-to-point chat connections between Jabber clients is the Cisco XCP Router. It is a core component of the Cisco Unified Communications system and provides routing and delivery of instant messages, presence updates, and other real-time communication data between clients. The Cisco XCP Router is responsible for ensuring that messages are delivered reliably and efficiently to their intended recipients and for maintaining the connection between the clients during the chat session.

For SIP to SIP instant messaging, the following services must be running on IM and Presence Service:
Cisco SIP Proxy
Cisco Presence Engine
Cisco XCP Router

For SIP to XMPP instant messaging, the following services must be running on IM and Presence Service:
Cisco SIP Proxy
Cisco Presence Engine
Cisco XCP Router
Cisco XCP Text Conference Manager

A and B Is correct

questions.question_text: Which DiffServ PHB preserves backward compatibility with any IP precedence scheme?
What are two Cisco UCM location bandwidths that are deducted when G.729 and G.711 codecs are used? (Choose two.)

choices.E: If a call uses G.729, Cisco UCM subtracts 40k
choices.B: If a call uses G.711, Cisco UCM subtracts 80k
choices.A: If a call uses G.729, Cisco UCM subtracts 16k
choices.C: If a call uses G.729, Cisco UCM subtracts 24k
choices.D: If a call uses G.711, Cisco UCM subtracts 64k

discussion.content:
G.711 audio call (64 kbps)

80 kbps

G.729 audio call (8 kbps)

24 kbps

Selected Answer: BC
• If the call is using G.711, Cisco Unified Communications Manager subtracts 80k. 
• If the call is using G.723, Cisco Unified Communications Manager subtracts 24k.
 • If the call is using G.729, Cisco Unified Communications Manager subtracts 24k.

Source: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/trouble/10_0_1/CUCM_BK_TA380A6B_00_troubleshooting-guide-cucm-100.pdf

Selected Answer: BC
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/srnd/collab12/collab12/cac.html

Selected Answer: BC
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/trouble/10_0_1/CUCM_BK_TA380A6B_00_troubleshooting-guide-cucm-100.pdf
per this document:
• If the call is using G.711, Cisco Unified Communications Manager subtracts 80k.
• If the call is using G.723, Cisco Unified Communications Manager subtracts 24k.
• If the call is using G.729, Cisco Unified Communications Manager subtracts 24k.

Selected Answer: AB
The bandwidths that are deducted by Cisco UCM for G.729 and G.711 codecs are:

A. If a call uses G.729, Cisco UCM subtracts 16k
B. If a call uses G.711, Cisco UCM subtracts 80k

Option C, If a call uses G.729, Cisco UCM subtracts 24k, and option E, If a call uses G.729, Cisco UCM subtracts 40k, are incorrect. These values are not deducted for G.729 codec usage in Cisco UCM.

Option D, If a call uses G.711, Cisco UCM subtracts 64k, is also incorrect. This value is not deducted for G.711 codec usage in Cisco UCM.
